alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 14 at 4:48PM PST until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 645 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. Minor mud and debris flow possible along highway 74 near the Fairview Fire burn scar. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 446 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moreno Valley, Temecula, Redlands, Yucaipa, northwestern Palm Springs, Hwy 243 Between Banning And Idyllwild, Idyllwild- Pine Cove, Mt San Jacinto State Park, Hemet and Anza. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
